page.title: 11The Manor House,Austerfield
page.content: The restored Elizabethan Manor House is white with black woodwork and a red tiled roof.It is a Tudor yeoman's house with two stories and the birth place of William Bradford in 1590.He sailed in the Mayflower and became the second governor of Massachusetts. Flowers grow on each side of the brick pathway leading to the front door.In front of the house is an Elizabethan pig wall.In the courtyard is a rusty water pump underneath which is a stone trough used by animals.This pump also has a tiled roof.In the centre is a pretty island flowerbed. At right angles to the house are former stables with servants quarters above.Next to this is a greenhouse containing many plants and garden equipment.Close to the greenhouse is a huge water tank used to water the plants.
